key_points: Economics studies how individuals, businesses, and governments allocate resources.
Microeconomics focuses on individual decision-making, while Macroeconomics deals with the economy as a whole.
As price increases, quantity demanded decreases, and vice versa, assuming all else equal.
As price increases, quantity supplied increases, and vice versa, assuming all else equal.
The cost of the next best alternative foregone; e.g., choosing study over work.
Capitalism (private ownership), Socialism (public control), Mixed Economy (combination).
Gross Domestic Product measures the total value of all goods and services produced in a country.
A sustained increase in the general price level of goods and services in an economy.
The state of not being employed, where labor is available but not utilized.
Regulating markets, managing fiscal policies (taxes and spending), controlling monetary policy.
